intro: Arthrosia duartei, commonly known as the Duarte's arthrosia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in tropical forests. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, clustered in umbels, and it produces berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, Arthrosia duartei is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
